abstract.p: New York Yankees begin preparations to replace manager Joe Torre when he decides to step down (S)

block.p: Yankees Manager Joe Torre has said he assumes he is coming back next year, the last year of his contract. But at least one Yankee executive has made some very informal inquiries about possible replacements, just in case Torre decides to leave after this season.
The Yankees want to be prepared if Torre leaves.

Yankees Manager Joe Torre has said he assumes he is coming back next year, the last year of his contract. But at least one Yankee executive has made some very informal inquiries about possible replacements, just in case Torre decides to leave after this season.
The Yankees want to be prepared if Torre leaves.
A Yankee official has asked others about possible managerial candidates, according to a baseball executive.

Based on what Torre said last month, however, there is no reason to think they will have to search for a replacement before next season. ''I'm assuming I'm coming back,'' Torre said. ''And being under contract, in my mind, I'm going to manage next year, because that's what I'm under contract to do.''
Torre could have left the Yankees last year, when he was treated for prostate cancer, but he elected to come back.
